text: Elfriede Brüning (8 November 1910 - 5 August 2014), also known as Elke Klent, was a German communist journalist and novelist. She worked for newspapers such as the Berliner Tageblatt, the Berliner Börsen-Courier and the Vossische Zeitung. Brüning was born in Berlin. In 1930, she joined the Communist Party of Germany. Before World War II, she was arrested in 1935 for communism- related activities, before being released in 1937. In 1937, she married Joachim Barckhausen, a writer and editor. Their daughter, Christiane, born in 1942, also became a writer. After the German reunification, she became a member of Die Linke (). Brüning turned 100 in November 2010. Brüning died from natural causes on 5 August 2014 in Berlin, aged 103. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1910 births Category:2014 deaths Category:German centenarians Category:German communists Category:German journalists Category:German novelists Category:German prisoners Category:Writers from Berlin
